Hi fellow devs! :wave:
What are the best tools to help you build custom coded emails nowadays? Which ones do you use?

Hey <@U04B0F7N1A6>, I'd say:
<http://MJML.io|MJML.io> -> Replace static stuff with Hubl via Design-Manager/CLI -> add HS responsive classes -> publish
What do you mean by "add HS responsive classes" ?

HubSpot(HS) adds quite a bunch of classes if you build an email with drag&drop for handling the responsiveness. So if you like to keep your html email as clean as possible, you can use those in your template. Also: Technically you could create your desired template with dnd, send a test mail, open the browser preview, grab all the code/classes and go from there. :wink:
I researched a lot about this on HubSpot Community articles, but found that instead of creating a Rich Text field type property, using a Single-Line Text field type property worked!
